intro: Dendrorkis usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara olive, is a species of flowering plant in the family Oleaceae. It is native to the montane forests of the Usambara Mountains in Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
